Your brother, Barkroot, lowers himself from the Worg, which is a large Hyena like beast, that he had been riding on and walks over to the thing at your feet. He nods at you but doesn't seem as concerned about this creature as you are.

"Stranger at village. He come for you." Your brother reports. You look at Barkroot cautiously wondering what this man could want with you. 11111.content:
The telling of the future was not unheard of. When you were younger, the elders used to tell stories of seers that would tell of the future. In all of the stories the advice of the seer would lead the tribe away from disaster. Almost everyone in the tribe thought that these stories were all false since a seer had not been seen in hundreds of years.

"Tell more." you grunt at the seer. A weak smile appears on the man's face. "Ten will rise before the fall. Save your blood and all will drown." With each word, the old man visibly became weaker and all he gave you was more riddles. "You speak of beasts I killed?" There had been ten of them. But that hadn't explained anything about what he meant about your blood, unless...

You turn around before the ancient man can speak. Could your brother be in danger? You rush to your Worg jumping onto his back, the creature giving a squeal of surprise. It doesn't take you long before you have it under control and it's flying across the hilly plains your tribe inhabits. As you approach the spot you had left Barkroot you see him engaged in battle with several men clad in the unnatural grey skins of their people. You yell out a battle roar as you push your Worg faster.

There are four of these intruders fighting your brother, it looks like your brother had already downed two of them, but his Worg already lay dead. You could jump off your Worg and have him keep two of them busy while you fight the other two or you could try to engage all four while mounted on top of your creature.
11111.title: Warning Too Late.

choices: Go after the prophet. It's the only way to stop the curse.
Follow the trail. You don't believe in curses.
11112.content:
"You, Leave" you command as you move forward bringing your bulk next to the frail man. The prophet slouches down and steps back, obviously intimidated by you. "Now!" you command as the man backs even further away from you.

"Your choice has doomed you" he warns. "All you love will fall" You let out a fierce growl and the man all but scurries away, you watch him until he is out of your sight. 'What a foolish moron,' you think.

As the rest of the day passes you don't bother to think much of the crazy man who had unwisely thought he could delude you with his words. It isn't until much later that you notice that you haven't seen your brother in quite some time. You retrieve your Worg where you had tied him up, and head back to where you had left your brother this morning.

By the time you arrive it's dark, so it isn't until you almost trample over your brother that you see him. You stop your beast and hop off rushing to your brother's side. He was many wounds on his body. It doesn't take you long to realize he's dead. You release a bellow of rage at this new discovery. How could this have happened? You immediately think back to the decrepit man's words 'All you love will fall' Did that madman place a curse on you? It seemed foolish to believe that something like that could even happen but his words still haunted you. You continue to look around where your brother had been slain, and find footprints leading in the opposite direction that the man had left your village. You believe you could follow those responsible if you wanted, but if you did you would lose the trail of the old prophet.

1112.content:
A man sitting against the wooden poll looked up at you as you entered the hut, His body completely wrapped in bandages. You began to wonder how this man managed to make it here in that shape. He looked like he was a tough man, but Those injuries were nothing ordinary. It was hard to tell what exactly had happened to him, but you could see spots where blood had soaked through the bandages he wore. "What you want?" You commanded the man. He continued to look at you with a dull gaze as he spoke "There are beasts," His voice sounded raspy and anguished "They've been attacking my town nightly. At first they weren't so bad, but their numbers kept growing. My companions and I came here to get help. I had been injured a couple nights ago and so I had been excused from keeping watch. When I woke up this Morning, they were all gone."

You don't move your eyes from the man as he tells his story. Too many of the elements of what he has said are becoming far too familiar for you. If what happened to the mans town is happening here then something must be done. You need to protect your people, You sympathize with the man but it's likely that his town may have already been destroyed. On the other hand it might be worth it to scout that way so you can learn about the enemy. Plus if anyone was alive from his town, they might hold the key to defeating this menace.

"Where your town at?" You asked sternly as you weighed your options. "About a two day walk to the east on foot, near the edge of the Nightwidow forest by the river. It's small, only a little over 1000 people... and that was before the attacks..." The man said as he let out a deep groan and grasped his side. "Please, your people are strong. If you go now... you may be able to save some of them before its too late." A few moments passed as you turned away called one of your fellows to come to the door. The man who came was almost as tall as you with a thick beard and many scars acrossed his face. "Yes, what now?" He asked as he walked inside the hut.


"Prepare some warriors and scouts. Tomorrow we set out at dawn to investigate this strange foe in nearby village. We also need guards to look over our own people while we gone." You say as you exit the hut to begin preparing for your trip the next day. "I tell others. We leave at first light!" The other barbarian shouts as he heads off to inform the others. You spend the rest of the day and part of the night gathering supplies, equipment, and tending to the Worgs you'd take with you. As soon as the night moon began rising you drifted off to sleep in your hut, eager to get a fresh start as soon as the sun rose on the next day...

A young man with a club walked inside your home and tapped his weapon lightly against the side of your supply chest. "Time to wake up. Time to go." He said as you stirred and let out a yawn. "Good. Me grab things and we can set out. How many we have?" You asked as you put on your tattered battle outfit and grabbed your share of the supplies from the chest. "12 go with us. The rest stay to guard our people." He replied as you followed him outside. The morning had just begun and fresh dew sparkled on the leaves and grass while the sun climbed higher into the sky.


"Let us set out, waste no time." You say as your mount your Worf and take a spot next to your brother and the barbarian you had talked to the previous day. With that you begin the journey to the injured mans village. Normally, it would have taken at least a day to reach, but with the detailed map he provided and your swift rides you managed to reach the fields outside the small town just a few hours into the afternoon. "Stay close. Probably dangerious." Your brother says as you and him take the lead in front of the others. The tall grass that had become overgrown in the absence of farmers made it hard for your Worfs to move quickly, though it did not matter as you intended to take a stealthy approach. Soon small houses began to appear as you move silently through the weeds...

11211.content:
Perry. You could tell that he had not gotten any sleep. You feel like comforting the boy, you reach out your hand to lay it on Perry's shoulder when a horn blasted out of the darkness.
Perry jumped in fright but you have become accustomed to this so you calmly go back inside and get dressed into your traveling gear.
"Perry, go make ready the horse while I get provisions for us" you say rummaging through a chest for a suitable outfit.
The boy just nodded, too tired to say 'yes sir', and stumbled off into the dark of the inner courtyard toward the stables.
Once you are done changing into your travel clothes you walk over to the closet and open it. Inside lies your armor of war. Even with the small amount of candlelight it shined as if with its own radiance.
It had been your father's armor and his father's before that. The crest on the breast plate was adorned by a gold two-headed snake. They entwined through the winding thorns of a rose bush. The back round was a dark blue. The outside of the shield was encrusted with waves.
You touch the armor and try to think of how many times it had seen battle and how many times it had saved your ancestors' lives. Perhaps it would keep you from death too. You hope anyway....
Then there was a knock on the door and you turn around to see Perry and his mother standing there. Perry was wide awake now but still had the sleep depraved look. His mother looked even more tired and at least ten years older than when you last saw her.
She must have been crying all night. You can see where the tears had been sloppily wiped away by unsteady hands.
You walk over to them and think years back to when you went to your first battle. You were Perry's age then and also had the job of being squire to one of your father's dearest friends, only because your father had perished two years before that in a battle with the Outlaws of Namyn. You also remember the look on your mother's face as you left the castle to battle, and possibly your doom. Your mother had looked nothing like Perry's had. Yours had a stern face that was weathered by years of toil and service. She was happy to send her son to serve the king. She would never forget to remind you that if you had no way of surviving then fight to your last and die a good, honorable death.
These thoughts are pushed away as Perry's mother throws herself into your chest and gives you a vice like hug.
"Take care of my boy, please! I can't lose him, he's all I got left! Bring him back to me alive. Can you do that?" she stares into your eyes pleadingly and waits for you to answer.
You hesitate because you know that by telling her the truth of the situation, you would break her spirit completely.
11211.title: The Departure

1122.content:
After a moment out from the shadows steps the sickly frail silhouette that could only belong to sir Henri. You had seen him earlier in the banquet hall and he had seen you…

Years ago you were called upon to train a young man, Sir Henri, in the arts of the sword. His father, lord Henri, was notorious for ruling with a strict harsh resolve. He wanted his runt first born to be able to defend his title and lands and asked the king for your services. You were not thrilled about teaching this young man the arts that he would in turn use to rule his kingdom in the same fashion as his father. Though it was your duty to serve the king, and no matter what your opinion was your honor was at stake.

A year into training lord Henri Succumbed to illness brought on by a battle wound. The king called upon you once more, this time to watch over the new young lord. Again you were to bear the burden of honor and agree to watch over the thirteen year old till his fifteenth birthday. Though that would never come to be. The lands changed kings with the change of the tides and a year after, lord Henri the king, fell as well. The young lord Henri played his part in the cue swearing his and his men's loyalty in the appending overthrow. Too much of your brothers blood was spilled during that two month battle. When the smoke cleared the new cruel king stood in place of a great one.

Leaving your land, you flee to the neighboring kingdom of Aralia. the new cruel king then pushed his kingdom farther north into Gesham taking the northern tip of the continent and holding it in a tight grip of fear. And then turned south purging Aralia into a bloody battle. You took part in the destruction of lord Henri’s lands and his king. Now it would seem that Aralias has its sights set upon Gesham. Pushing now to destroy the last of the cruel kings control.

Taking only a few steps out into the light he turns back towards the door that Perry made his exit through. His glance lasting for only a moment before lets out a deep sigh. Turning his attention back to you, his gaze drops to meet your readied sword.
“you don’t intend on using that this night do you?” pausing for a second you debate the answer before sheathing your sword and turning back to your saddle “not tonight Sir Henri”.
heaving your saddle up off of your steed you hang it over the log railing and pull out a brush. Bending over you begin to scrape at the horses hoof “what is you’re business here?”

Taking a few more slow strides he comes to rest against a main support beam at the head of your quarter horse.
“that was quite the spectacle your young companion made today”.

“aye it was, he still has much to learn.” looking up into his awaiting glance “reminds me of another I once knew”
“ahh I was not that bad” reaching into his vest he fumbles through it until he finds his mark and pulls out a pipe.

Dropping the horses leg you stand up and begin wiping your hands off with a rag. “from what I remember your first battle you soiled yourself” making direct eye contact you move to the next leg, not sure as to how he will take that comment.

“I guess that will be one of the many stories that will die with you”
Not giving him time to take another breath you thrust the back of your left hand deep into his gut while turning upwards into his lower left ribs with your right. Surprised and stunned Sir Henri stumble back a couple of steps before coming crashing down to his back. Gasping for air he coughs violently as he rolls over to a fetal position.

“listen, if I see you on the battle field run.. Do you hear me?” you wait for a second before kicking him again in the ribs “run!”

You rush out of the burning monastery that had once been you home. The heat pressed toward you evaporating the sweat that would normally be on your brow. You look around for the thing you had been chasing. Things were just not going well for you today.

Your day had started the same as any other You got up, put on your robes, and came outside for some fresh air. that's where things started going bad. One of the statues of your deity broke and the arm had come off. You knew that your superiors wouldn't be pleased so you had searched all morning for someone to fix it. Then when that was done other monks, like yourself, had reported that all of the small holy symbols that the Monks of this monastery were supposed to carry at all times were missing. as soon as you checked your side for yours you had realized that yours was missing too.

The rest of your day had been spent looking for the criminal responsible. Around sunset you had retired to your room unsuccessfully only to find all of the holy symbols piled on the floor in your room. You didn't have time to ponder it however because from elsewhere in building, someone had yelled out that there was a fire. You looked outside just in time to notice a man dressed entirely in black pass by your room. running for the exit. you managed to tackle the assailant onto the floor. You struggled with your adversary for many minutes before you managed to tear off the black mask that he wore. You had been caught completely off guard by what you had seen. Unfortunately he used that moment to kick you off him and flee toward the exit of the monastery. You noticed that by that point everything was burning up. You had then run out of the monastery as well.

Which brought you to where you are now. You see some people trying to put out the building you had just escaped from. you also see the thing that you fought earlier running off in what was now the night. The thing you had seen was not human, It had dark red skin and small horns. its eyes were so dark that they looked like you could fall in and become lost.

1252.content:
You step forward into your position and watch as Star Sky does the same. The signal is given for you both to start the fight. As soon as you hear the Woman managing the fight scream to fight you rush forward, your powerful legs taking you quickly across the clearing. If you can catch her off guard, perhaps you can tip the battle in your favor. As you continue your charge you notice a small smile on your friend's face. She had been expecting this and had her feet planted, ready to meet your charge, head on. Seeing this, you quickly change what would have been a full on body check to a running sweep. She lifts her foot to avoid your sweep as her fist come boldly towards your head, Star Sky only narrowly connects with the top of your head. It's not enough to cause any real damage, but It does cause you to fall onto your back. She quickly moves on top of you and puts you into a choke lock

"Give up" Your long time friend whispers to you as you feel the air escaping from your lungs, You try to Speak but you only succeed in losing more air. A big mistake on your part. "please" she whispers again, only you can hear it over the sound of the roaring crowd.
